title: Introducing: Night Flowers
content:
Hailing from London and composed of Chris Hardy and Greg Ullyart, Night Flowers describe themselves as ‘the product of two men… [with] some ideas and an eight track recorder’, which seems like a pretty decent albeit humble starting point to me. Drafting in friends and relatives for their debut EP Beginnings, they create a sound that is both refreshingly varied and instantaneously enjoyable. Opener Neverlands is a shoegaze inspired number, with touches of Ride and Slowdive amongst the acoustic guitars and reverb laden vocals. Whilst it’s clear that Night Flowers are far from the finished product, this collection of tracks if one of the most accomplished debut outings I’ve heard in a long time, with the stunning Dials standing out as a particular highlight.

Modest and refined, the repeated refrain “I don’t sleep well anymore” is delivered with immaculate and considered resplendence, elevating the track beyond the realms of being simply another lo-fi meets shoegaze revival affair. Check out the video for Dials below, directed by Ryan Haysom, and grab the full EP underneath that.
